org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.AbstractLifeCycle

org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
ContinuousIntegrationServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.jetty.server.Handler, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Container, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Destroyable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.Dumpable, org.eclipse.jetty.util.component.LifeCycle
public class ContinuousIntegrationServer extends org.eclipse.jetty.server.handler.AbstractHandler
Skeleton of a ContinuousIntegrationServer which acts as webhook See the Jetty documentation for API documentation of those classes.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Nelly Åkerblom, Oskar Edvardsson, Jacob Brännström, Elsa Benzinger, Anna Jargård

  • Method Details

    • createBuildLog

      public FileWriter createBuildLog​(String target, org.eclipse.jetty.server.Request baseRequest, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, com.google.gson.JsonObject jo) throws IOException
      Creates the build log and appends that name to the builds file
      Parameters:
      target - the target
      baseRequest - the unwrapped request
      request - the wrapped request
      response - the reponse we are writing
      Returns:
      a FileWrite that corresponds to the buildLog we can further add onto as necessary
      Throws:
      IOException - if we can't create or reach either of the files.

    • closeBuildLog

      public void closeBuildLog​(FileWriter logFile) throws IOException
      Closes the build log and adds the last things!
      Parameters:
      logFile - the build log we will be closing.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • printlnResponse

      public void printlnResponse​(FileWriter logFile, String message) throws IOException
      A helper function so we can write the same things to both the logFile and the response to git
      Parameters:
      response - we are writing to git
      logFile - we are writing to the build log
      message - we are writing
      Throws:
      IOException

    • sendEMail

      public void sendEMail​(String recipientAddress, String subject, String message)
      A method that sends email based on tutorial by netcore: https://netcorecloud.com/tutorials/send-email-in-java-using-gmail-smtp/
      Parameters:
      recipientAddress - the email address of the recipient
      subject - the subject of the email
      message - the text included in the email
